column2: Action (Case manager assures coordinated action and follow-up)
Provide caregiver lead education: dietary and environmental, Follow-up blood lead testing within 30 days to assure not rising, Within 30 days Refer for WIC and social services, if needed
Above actions, plus: Proceed according to actions for 20-40 ug/dL if: A follow-up blood lead is 15 or above, or the blood lead level is increasing
Above actions, plus: Provide coordination of care (case management), Provide environmental investigation and control lead hazards
Above actions, plus: Hospitalize child and begin medical treatment (chelation therapy as appropriate) immediately. Contact Emergency Lead Healthcare line.
